item.title: You're Not Early. You're Just Hiding.
item.description: Most founders aren't early. They're scared. And 'early' becomes the safest excuse to stay invisible while momentum slowly dies.
item.content:encoded:
# You're Not Early. You're Just Hiding.
*"I'm still early."*
That sentence sounds harmless.
Even smart.
Founders say it with confidence—like they're playing the long game.
But look closer.
Six months in. A finished product. A clean UI. A working checkout.
**And zero users.**
That's not early.
**That's avoidance.**

item.description: Discover why SaaS feature bloat drives user churn and how 'purposeful subtraction' can save your product. Learn to overcome the founder fear that leads to complex, confusing software.
item.content:encoded:
## The Real Pain of SaaS Feature Bloat
I didn’t hate SaaS tools because they were *bad*.
I hated them because they **stole my time**.
Not in small bites. Not in “oops I clicked something.” But in big, silent drains caused by **feature bloat**.
I paid for “premium.” Upgraded. Subscribed. Committed.
I got:
- Fancy templates - Hundreds of widgets - Animations that look cool on sales pages

# 5 Lessons from My First Year as an Indie Hacker
After a year of building products independently, here are the most valuable lessons I've learned.
## 1. Ideas Are Cheap, Execution Is Everything
Everyone has ideas. The difference between dreamers and builders is **execution**.
I used to spend weeks perfecting ideas in my head. Now I validate them in days.
